name: Database Management Fundamentals

topics.description: This topic explores the fundamental concepts of databases, including the structure of data using tables, schemas, and relationships. You will learn how these elements work together to organize and manage information efficiently.
references: Codd, E. F. (1970). A relational model of data for large shared data banks. Communications of the ACM, 13(6), 377-387.
Elmasri, R., & Navathe, S. B. (2019). Fundamentals of database systems. Pearson Education.

topics.description: This topic introduces Structured Query Language (SQL), a standard language used to interact with relational databases. You will learn how to write basic SQL queries to retrieve, insert, update, and delete data.
references: Date, C. J. (2000). An introduction to database systems. Pearson Education.

topics.description: This topic focuses on designing and creating relational database schemas. You will learn about data modeling principles, entity-relationship diagrams, and normalization techniques to ensure data integrity and efficiency.
references: Ramakrishnan, R., & Gehrke, J. (2003). Database management systems. McGraw-Hill Education.
Kroenke, D. (2019). Database system: Concepts, design, and implementation using SQL. Pearson Education.

topics.description: This topic delves into database normalization, a process of organizing data to reduce redundancy and improve data integrity. You will learn about different normal forms and their impact on database design.
references: Silberschatz, A., Korth, H. F., & Sudarshan, S. (2010). Database system concepts. McGraw-Hill Education.
Garcia-Molina, H., Ullman, J. D., & Widom, J. (2009). Database systems: The complete book (2nd ed.). Prentice Hall.

topics.description: This topic explores different types of database management systems, including relational, NoSQL, and cloud-based databases. You will understand the strengths and weaknesses of each type and their suitability for different applications.
references: Stonebraker, M. (2016). Databases for the next 40 years. Proceedings of the VLDB Endowment, 9(12), 1628-1637.
Amazon Web Services. (n.d.). Amazon DynamoDB. https://aws.amazon.com/dynamodb/

description: This module introduces the core concepts of database management systems. You'll explore different database types, learn SQL queries, and understand data modeling principles.
aims: Define and explain key database concepts such as tables, schemas, and relationships.
Write basic SQL queries to retrieve, insert, update, and delete data.
Design and create simple relational database schemas.
